forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 15. Northwest wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 25. Northwest wind 12 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 32 mph.

weather_report:
As the early hours of the morning embrace Boston, a crisp clarity envelops the city, with the temperature dipping down to a frigid 15 degrees, carried by the brisk northwest winds. The darkness of the night is punctuated by the twinkling city lights, casting a serene glow against the starkness of the cold. This stillness, complemented by gusty gusts reaching up to 28 mph, has a unique way of nudging one into a contemplative reverie, a reminder of the peaceful solitude winter offers.

As dawn unfolds, the day promises a bright and cheerful ambiance with unbroken sunshine illuminating the landscape. Anticipate a mild high of about 25 degrees, a welcome reprieve despite the persistent winds that will continue to nudge at your coat. It is a day well-suited for engaging with the outdoors—perhaps a stroll along the Charles, where the water dances in the light, or a visit to a local café to savor a steaming cup of coffee as you warm your hands against the chill. In dress, layering is advisable; a warm, insulated coat, sturdy boots, and a soft scarf will ensure comfort against the brisk air. In this picturesque winter setting, one can relish the simple delights life has to offer, turning a mundane Tuesday into a moment of quiet appreciation amid the hustle and bustle of the season.
